CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - Government to pay outstanding judgment debt;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the town of GPE , the GPE region .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant had a serious accident at work and from that time onwards was entitled to occupational disability benefit – including compensation for a purchase of a car designed for disabled persons DATE from the GPE coal mine ( a ORG owned entity , hereafter “ the Coal Mine ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG awarded the applicant UAH CARDINAL ( approximately EUR CARDINAL ) against the Coal Mine for its failure to pay compensation for a car .
CARDINAL . The judgment became effective and was sent for execution to ORG ( hereafter “ ORG ” ) , which on DATE instituted enforcement proceedings in the applicant 's case .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG informed the applicant that the attachment and sale proceedings concerning ORG assets were suspended due to the moratorium on the forced sale of the property of ORG - owned enterprises .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered ORG liquidation , designating ORG as its successor . The coal mine 's liquidation commission was established and on DATE it was entrusted with the enforcement of the applicant 's writ of execution .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered that ORG split up and its funds be divided between the Luganskuglrestrukrutizatsyya and the Donetskvuglrestrukrutizatsyya Companies .

CARDINAL . On DATE the writ of execution was returned unenforced to ORG , which reopened the enforcement proceedings . On account of the liquidation of the coal mine and ORG on DATE suspended the proceedings pending the replacement of the debtor in the applicant 's case .
CARDINAL . From the parties ' submissions it appears that the judgment in the applicant 's favour remains unenforced .

CARDINAL . Some of the relevant domestic law is set out in the judgments of CARDINAL July CARDINAL in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE ) , of DATE in the case of GPE v. GPE ( no . GPE , § § DATE ) and of DATE in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . GPE , § § CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) .
